intro: Aeollanthus butaguensis, commonly known as the Butagué bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Aeollanthus butaguensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
